intro: Moricandia patula, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of four-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Moricandia patula is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its hardy nature.
